result.execSummary:
The defendant Gary S Williams Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft of Library Material (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.61(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gary S Williams Jr.

records.addlTxt: Revoked

Defendant Gary S Williams in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Defendant Gary S Williams in custody and appears via video from Taylor County Jail.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:23 AM. State - here for sentencing after revocation. Lynch - defendant has agreed to appear via video today - recommends jail term of 224 days - 225 days credit - restitution was $224.00 and that would be dollar for day for restitution - has reviewed revocation paperwork and do not see any inaccuracies. Court goes thru defendant's right to be in person when being sentenced and makes sure the defendant is in agreement with appearing via video as opposed to in person. Defendant assures Court it is in agreement with appearing via video. Court is satisfied as is the State and Attorney Lynch that the defendant is OK with appearing via video for today's proceedings, finds he has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his personal appearance today. State - stipulates to 225 days credit - asks for civil judgement for unpaid financial obligations. Lost video connection at 10:33 AM. Back on record with video working at 10:36 AM. Lynch recommends time served sentence for stated reasons. Williams asks Court to follow the recommendation of his counsel. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 224 days in jail - credit for 224 days (stipulated), turn any unpaid financial obligations into civil judgment, right to appeal, adjourned at 10:39 AM.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Gary S Williams in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Defendant Gary S Williams in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:19 AM. State - resolved - plead g/nc to only count as alleged, joint recommendation of 1 year probation with conditions of: restitution of $223.98 plus 22.39 for a total of $246.37 within first 6 months, any other conditions as stated by the Court. Lynch and Williams agree. Williams pleads NC to only count as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State - follow joint recommendation. Lynch- follow joint recommendation - credit for 96 days if revoked. Williams makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: withhold sentence and place on probation for 1 year with conditions of: restitution in the amount of $246.37 (including VW surcharge - Crandon Library) - to be paid to COC Office but will have the year of probation to pay it/CO, costs - 60 DTP/CO, submit DNA sample, right to appeal, adjourned.
Jury trial on May 25, 2017 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Gary S Williams Jr.
Current: N2044 White Birch, Keshena, WI 54135 United States  (Effective: 04-12-2017)
Prior: 303 Seymour Street, Wausau, WI 54403 United States

Defendant Gary S Williams in court with attorney Anne M. Katte who has Attorney Lynch appearing specially for her.  Defendant Gary S Williams in custody who appears via video from FOSO.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:30 PM. State makes statement in regards to if the defendant pays $223.98, he will dismiss the case. Lynch asks defendant when he can post that. Williams responds. Court sets bond at $300.00 cash. Lynch makes argument for signature bond. Court still sets bond at $300.00. Williams makes statement in regards to the reason he missed the last court date - homeless for 6 months. Court sets for JT.  Jury trial scheduled for May 25, 2017 at 08:30 am.
In custody FOSO
from def to court re: quashing warrant and asking for payment plan - court sets for date as def is on FTA warrant. Per court set for hearing and DA to writ here.
Return on warrant on April 12, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
Warrant detainer-Oneida County
September 9, 2016 Return on Warrant/Inital Appearance

Attorney Anne M. Katte in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:10 PM. State - the matter was going to be amended to a county ordinance once the restitution was paid in full. Clerk informs that there is not any money posted. Katte - offer is acceptable but the defendant did not have a ride from Keshena area. State requests a bench warrant, body or $300.00. Court orders bench warrant, body or $300.00.
state
Final pre-trial on November 2, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Gary S Williams in court with attorney Chad Lynch who appears specially for Anne Katte.  Defendant Gary S Williams in custody and appears via video from FOSO.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:19 AM. Lynch - Katte has received a FPT date of 11/2/16 at 2:00 PM. Williams states he does not have the complaint. Court reads charges and penalties. Williams and Lynch understand charges and penalties and enters NG pleas to all counts. State - bond - no objections to signature bond for stated reasons (currently serving a sentence). Williams states he is not sitting a sentence on this case. Lynch - no obejctions to a signature bond. Court - bond - $300 signature bond.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 2, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
